page.title: 03Hospitals in Woking.
page.content: The Woking, Horsell and Woodham Cottage Hospital started in 1894 in a converted house. From money collected during Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee a new hospital was built in Chobham Road and opened in 1899, called the{Woking {Victoria Hospital.}This is now a part of the National Health Service but its future is uncertain as it is small and in need of modernisation. Its facilities include a minor casualty unit and out-patient and X-ray departments. Serious cases are referred to St. Peter's Hospital in Chertsey. { The Woking Nuffield Hospital}in Shores Road is a modern private hospital run by B.U.P.A., the British United Provident Association. Recent building has greatly increased the accomodation and facilities available.
